xtrack_tools API¶

xtrack_tools.env.create_xsuite_environment(beam=None, sequence_file=None, beam_energy=6800, seq_name=None, rerun_madx=False, json_file=None)[source]¶

Create or load an xsuite environment for a given MAD-X sequence.

The environment is generated from a MAD-X sequence file and cached to JSON. If the cached JSON exists and is newer than the sequence file, it will be used unless rerun_madx is set to True.

Parameters:

  • beam (int | None) – LHC beam number to resolve the default sequence file, if sequence_file is not provided.

  • sequence_file (Path | None) – Path to a MAD-X sequence file. Required if beam is not set.

  • beam_energy (float) – Beam energy in GeV used to set the particle reference.

  • seq_name (str | None) – Sequence name inside the environment; defaults to the file stem.

  • rerun_madx (bool) – Force regeneration of the JSON cache by rerunning MAD-X.

  • json_file (Path | None) – Optional path for the cached JSON representation.

Return type:

Environment

Returns:

The loaded xt.Environment with particle reference set.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If neither beam nor sequence_file is provided.

  • FileNotFoundError – If the sequence file is missing when regeneration is needed.

xtrack_tools.env.initialise_env(matched_tunes, magnet_strengths, corrector_table, beam=None, sequence_file=None, beam_energy=6800, seq_name=None, json_file=None, strict_set=True)[source]¶

Initialise an xsuite environment with tune knobs, magnet strengths, and correctors.

Parameters:

  • matched_tunes (dict[str, float]) – Mapping of tune knob names to values (e.g., dqx_b1_op).

  • magnet_strengths (dict[str, float]) – Mapping of element variable names to strengths, such as mqy.b5l2.b1.k1.

  • corrector_table (TfsDataFrame) – TFS table with corrector settings.

  • beam (int | None) – LHC beam number to resolve the default sequence file.

  • sequence_file (Path | None) – Path to the MAD-X sequence file.

  • beam_energy (float) – Beam energy in GeV.

  • seq_name (str | None) – Sequence name inside the environment.

  • json_file (Path | None) – Optional path for cached JSON environment.

  • strict_set – If True, validate existing corrector strengths before applying.

Return type:

Environment

Returns:

The configured xt.Environment ready for tracking or optics analysis.

Raises:

ValueError – If tune knob names do not match the expected format.

xtrack_tools.monitors.insert_particle_monitors_at_pattern(line, pattern, num_turns=10000, num_particles=1, inplace=False)[source]¶

Insert ParticlesMonitor elements at locations matching a regex pattern.

Parameters:

  • line (Line) – The line to modify.

  • pattern (str) – Regex pattern used to select element names.

  • num_turns (int) – Number of turns to record.

  • num_particles (int) – Number of particles to track in each monitor.

  • inplace (bool) – If True, modify line in place; otherwise operate on a copy.

Return type:

Line

Returns:

The line containing inserted monitors.

xtrack_tools.monitors.line_to_dataframes(tracked_line)[source]¶

Convert monitor data in a tracked line into per-particle DataFrames.

Each returned DataFrame contains the monitor name, turn index (1-based), and transverse coordinates for a single particle.

Parameters:

tracked_line (Line) – Line containing ParticlesMonitor elements with data.

Return type:

list[DataFrame]

Returns:

A list of DataFrames, one per particle.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If no monitors exist or monitors have inconsistent particle counts.

  • AssertionError – If particles were lost during tracking.

xtrack_tools.monitors.process_tracking_data(monitored_line, ramp_turns=1000, flattop_turns=100, add_variance_columns=True)[source]¶

Trim ramp turns from tracking data and optionally add variance columns.

Parameters:

  • monitored_line (Line) – Line with monitor data already collected.

  • ramp_turns (int) – Number of initial turns to discard.

  • flattop_turns (int) – Number of turns to keep after the ramp (informational).

  • add_variance_columns (bool) – Whether to add default variance and kick-plane columns.

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

A single DataFrame containing processed tracking data for the first particle.

xtrack_tools.monitors.xsuite_tws_to_ng(tws)[source]¶

Convert an xsuite Twiss object to an NG-compatible tfs DataFrame.

Parameters:

tws – xsuite Twiss object.

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

A tfs.TfsDataFrame with NG-compatible column names and headers.

xtrack_tools.tracking.run_tracking(line, particles, nturns)[source]¶

Track particles through a line for a fixed number of turns.

Parameters:

  • line (Line) – The xsuite line to track through.

  • particles (Particles) – Particles to track.

  • nturns (int) – Number of turns to track.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If tracking ends with non-successful particle state.

Return type:

None

xtrack_tools.tracking.run_tracking_without_ac_dipole(line, tws, flattop_turns, bpm_pattern='bpm.*[^k]', particle_coords=None, action_list=None, angle_list=None, kick_both_planes=True, start_marker=None, delta_values=None, context=None)[source]¶

Track particles without an AC dipole, inserting BPM monitors on a copy of the line.

Parameters:

  • line (xt.Line) – Base line to copy and track.

  • tws (xt.TwissTable) – Twiss data used to convert action-angle to coordinates.

  • flattop_turns (int) – Number of turns to track at flat top.

  • bpm_pattern (str) – Regex pattern for BPM element names.

  • particle_coords (dict[str, list[float]] | None) – Explicit particle coordinate arrays.

  • action_list (list[float] | None) – Action values used with angle_list to build coordinates.

  • angle_list (list[float] | None) – Angle values used with action_list to build coordinates.

  • kick_both_planes (bool) – If True, use action-angle in both planes.

  • start_marker (str | None) – Optional marker name to set as the first element.

  • delta_values (list[float] | None) – Optional momentum offsets per particle.

  • context (Context | None) – Optional xobjects context.

Return type:

xt.Line

Returns:

The monitored line after tracking.

Raises:

ValueError – If neither explicit coordinates nor action-angle inputs are provided.

xtrack_tools.tracking.start_tracking_xsuite_batch(env, batch_start, batch_end, action_list, angle_list, twiss_data, kick_both_planes, flattop_turns, progress_interval, num_tracks, true_deltap, seq_name)[source]¶

Track a batch of particles defined by action-angle coordinates.

Parameters:

  • env (Environment) – xsuite environment containing the target sequence.

  • batch_start (int) – Inclusive start index for the batch.

  • batch_end (int) – Exclusive end index for the batch.

  • action_list (list[float]) – Action values for initial conditions.

  • angle_list (list[float]) – Angle values for initial conditions.

  • twiss_data (TfsDataFrame) – Twiss data table for coordinate conversion.

  • kick_both_planes (bool) – If True, initialize both planes.

  • flattop_turns (int) – Number of turns to track.

  • progress_interval (int) – Logging interval for batch progress.

  • num_tracks (int) – Total number of tracks for progress reporting.

  • true_deltap (float) – Momentum deviation applied to all particles.

  • seq_name (str) – Sequence name in the environment.

Return type:

Line

Returns:

The tracked line with monitors inserted.

xtrack_tools.acd.insert_ac_dipole(line, tws, beam, acd_ramp, total_turns, driven_tunes, lag=0.0)[source]¶

Insert horizontal and vertical AC dipoles at the AC dipole marker.

Parameters:

  • line (Line) – Base line to copy and modify.

  • tws (TwissTable) – Twiss table used for beta functions at the AC dipole.

  • beam (int) – LHC beam number used for marker naming.

  • acd_ramp (int) – Number of ramp turns.

  • total_turns (int) – Total tracking turns at flat top.

  • driven_tunes (list[float]) – Driven tunes (horizontal, vertical).

  • lag (float) – Phase lag for the AC dipoles.

Return type:

Line

Returns:

A new line with AC dipole elements inserted.

xtrack_tools.acd.prepare_acd_line_with_monitors(line, tws, beam, ramp_turns, flattop_turns, driven_tunes, lag, bpm_pattern, num_particles)[source]¶

Insert AC dipole and monitors; return monitored line and total turns.

Parameters:

  • line (xt.Line) – Base line to copy and modify.

  • tws (xt.TwissTable | None) – Optional twiss table; computed if not provided.

  • beam (int) – LHC beam number used for marker naming.

  • ramp_turns (int) – Number of ramp turns.

  • flattop_turns (int) – Number of flat-top turns.

  • driven_tunes (list[float]) – Driven tunes (horizontal, vertical).

  • lag (float) – Phase lag for the AC dipoles.

  • bpm_pattern (str) – Regex pattern for BPM locations.

  • num_particles (int) – Number of particles to track.

Return type:

tuple[xt.Line, int]

Returns:

A tuple of (monitored_line, total_turns).

xtrack_tools.acd.run_ac_dipole_tracking_with_particles(line, tws=None, beam=1, ramp_turns=1000, flattop_turns=100, driven_tunes=None, lag=0.0, bpm_pattern='bpm.*[^k]', particle_coords=None, action_list=None, angle_list=None, kick_both_planes=True, start_marker=None, delta_values=None)[source]¶

Track multiple particles with an AC dipole using explicit or action-angle inputs.

Parameters:

  • line (xt.Line) – Base line to copy and modify.

  • tws (xt.TwissTable | None) – Optional twiss table; computed if not provided.

  • beam (int) – LHC beam number used for marker naming.

  • ramp_turns (int) – Number of ramp turns.

  • flattop_turns (int) – Number of flat-top turns.

  • driven_tunes (list[float] | None) – Driven tunes (horizontal, vertical). Defaults to a typical pair.

  • lag (float) – Phase lag for the AC dipoles.

  • bpm_pattern (str) – Regex pattern for BPM locations.

  • particle_coords (dict[str, list[float]] | None) – Explicit coordinates for each particle.

  • action_list (list[float] | None) – Action values for initial conditions.

  • angle_list (list[float] | None) – Angle values for initial conditions.

  • kick_both_planes (bool) – If True, initialize both planes.

  • start_marker (str | None) – Optional marker name to set as the first element.

  • delta_values (list[float] | None) – Optional momentum offsets per particle.

Return type:

xt.Line

Returns:

The monitored line after tracking.

Raises:

ValueError – If neither explicit coordinates nor action-angle inputs are provided.

xtrack_tools.acd.run_acd_track(sequence_file, delta_p=0.0, ramp_turns=1000, flattop_turns=100, driven_tunes=None, beam=1, bpm_pattern='(?i)bpm.*', json_path=None, add_variance_columns=True)[source]¶

Run AC dipole tracking for a sequence file and return tracking data.

Parameters:

  • sequence_file (Path) – Path to the MAD-X sequence file.

  • delta_p (float) – Momentum deviation for the tracked particle.

  • ramp_turns (int) – Number of ramp turns.

  • flattop_turns (int) – Number of flat-top turns.

  • driven_tunes (list[float] | None) – Driven tunes (horizontal, vertical). Defaults to a typical pair.

  • beam (int) – LHC beam number used for marker naming.

  • bpm_pattern (str) – Regex pattern for BPM locations.

  • json_path (Path | None) – Optional JSON cache path.

  • add_variance_columns (bool) – Whether to add default variance columns to the output.

Return type:

tuple[DataFrame, TwissTable, Line]

Returns:

Tuple of (tracking_df, twiss_table, baseline_line).

xtrack_tools.acd.run_acd_twiss(line, beam, dpp, driven_tunes)[source]¶

Run a twiss calculation with AC dipole elements inserted.

Parameters:

  • line (Line) – Base line to copy and modify.

  • beam (int) – LHC beam number used for marker naming.

  • dpp (float) – Momentum deviation for twiss calculation.

  • driven_tunes (list[float]) – Driven tunes (horizontal, vertical).

Return type:

TwissTable

Returns:

A Twiss table including AC dipole elements.

Raises:

ValueError – If the AC dipole marker is not found.
